   1 # -*- coding=utf-8 -*-
   2 from __future__ import absolute_import, print_function, unicode_literals
   3 
   4 import os
   5 import re
   6 
   7 import colorama
   8 import six
   9 
  10 from .compat import to_native_string
  11 
  12 DISABLE_COLORS = os.getenv("CI", False) or os.getenv(
  13     "ANSI_COLORS_DISABLED", os.getenv("VISTIR_DISABLE_COLORS", False)
  14 )
  15 
  16 
  17 ATTRIBUTE_NAMES = ["bold", "dark", "", "underline", "blink", "", "reverse", "concealed"]
  18 ATTRIBUTES = dict(zip(ATTRIBUTE_NAMES, range(1, 9)))
  19 del ATTRIBUTES[""]
  20 
  21 colors = ["grey", "red", "green", "yellow", "blue", "magenta", "cyan", "white"]
  22 COLORS = dict(zip(colors, range(30, 38)))
  23 HIGHLIGHTS = dict(zip(["on_{0}".format(c) for c in colors], range(40, 48)))
  24 ANSI_REMOVAL_RE = re.compile(r"\033\[((?:\d|;)*)([a-zA-Z])")
  25 
  26 
  27 COLOR_MAP = {
  28     # name: type
  29     "blink": "attrs",
  30     "bold": "attrs",
  31     "concealed": "attrs",
  32     "dark": "attrs",
  33     "reverse": "attrs",
  34     "underline": "attrs",
  35     "blue": "color",
  36     "cyan": "color",
  37     "green": "color",
  38     "magenta": "color",
  39     "red": "color",
  40     "white": "color",
  41     "yellow": "color",
  42     "on_blue": "on_color",
  43     "on_cyan": "on_color",
  44     "on_green": "on_color",
  45     "on_grey": "on_color",
  46     "on_magenta": "on_color",
  47     "on_red": "on_color",
  48     "on_white": "on_color",
  49     "on_yellow": "on_color",
  50 }
  51 COLOR_ATTRS = COLOR_MAP.keys()
  52 
  53 
  54 RESET = colorama.Style.RESET_ALL
  55 
  56 
  57 def colored(text, color=None, on_color=None, attrs=None):
  58     """Colorize text using a reimplementation of the colorizer from
  59     https://github.com/pavdmyt/yaspin so that it works on windows.
  60 
  61     Available text colors:
  62         red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white.
  63 
  64     Available text highlights:
  65         on_red, on_green, on_yellow, on_blue, on_magenta, on_cyan, on_white.
  66 
  67     Available attributes:
  68         bold, dark, underline, blink, reverse, concealed.
  69 
  70     Example:
  71         colored('Hello, World!', 'red', 'on_grey', ['blue', 'blink'])
  72         colored('Hello, World!', 'green')
  73     """
  74     return colorize(text, fg=color, bg=on_color, attrs=attrs)
  75 
  76 
  77 def colorize(text, fg=None, bg=None, attrs=None):
  78     if os.getenv("ANSI_COLORS_DISABLED") is None:
  79         style = "NORMAL"
  80         if attrs is not None and not isinstance(attrs, list):
  81             _attrs = []
  82             if isinstance(attrs, six.string_types):
  83                 _attrs.append(attrs)
  84             else:
  85                 _attrs = list(attrs)
  86             attrs = _attrs
  87         if attrs and "bold" in attrs:
  88             style = "BRIGHT"
  89             attrs.remove("bold")
  90         if fg is not None:
  91             fg = fg.upper()
  92             text = to_native_string("%s%s%s%s%s") % (
  93                 to_native_string(getattr(colorama.Fore, fg)),
  94                 to_native_string(getattr(colorama.Style, style)),
  95                 to_native_string(text),
  96                 to_native_string(colorama.Fore.RESET),
  97                 to_native_string(colorama.Style.NORMAL),
  98             )
  99 
 100         if bg is not None:
 101             bg = bg.upper()
 102             text = to_native_string("%s%s%s%s") % (
 103                 to_native_string(getattr(colorama.Back, bg)),
 104                 to_native_string(text),
 105                 to_native_string(colorama.Back.RESET),
 106                 to_native_string(colorama.Style.NORMAL),
 107             )
 108 
 109         if attrs is not None:
 110             fmt_str = to_native_string("%s[%%dm%%s%s[9m") % (chr(27), chr(27))
 111             for attr in attrs:
 112                 text = fmt_str % (ATTRIBUTES[attr], text)
 113 
 114         text += RESET
 115     else:
 116         text = ANSI_REMOVAL_RE.sub("", text)
 117     return text
 118 
 119 
 120 def cprint(text, color=None, on_color=None, attrs=None, **kwargs):
 121     """Print colorize text.
 122 
 123     It accepts arguments of print function.
 124     """
 125 
 126     print((colored(text, color, on_color, attrs)), **kwargs)
